com.github.rholder.moar.concurrent

Class StrategicExecutors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.rholder.moar.concurrent.StrategicExecutors

  • public class StrategicExecutors
extends java.lang.Object
    Provide some convenience functions for creating new BalancingThreadPoolExecutor instances.

    • Method Detail

      • newBalancingThreadPoolExecutor

        public static BalancingThreadPoolExecutor newBalancingThreadPoolExecutor(int maxThreads,
                                                         float targetUtilization)
        Return a capped BalancingThreadPoolExecutor with the given maximum number of threads and target utilization. The default smoothing weight and balance after constants are used.
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - maximum number of threads to use
        targetUtilization - a float between 0.0 and 1.0 representing the percentage of the total CPU time to be used by this pool

      • newBalancingThreadPoolExecutor

        public static BalancingThreadPoolExecutor newBalancingThreadPoolExecutor(int maxThreads,
                                                         float targetUtilization,
                                                         float smoothingWeight,
                                                         int balanceAfter)
        Return a capped BalancingThreadPoolExecutor with the given maximum number of threads, target utilization, smoothing weight, and balance after values.
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - maximum number of threads to use
        targetUtilization - a float between 0.0 and 1.0 representing the percentage of the total CPU time to be used by this pool
        smoothingWeight - smooth out the averages of the CPU and wait time over time such that tasks aren't too heavily skewed with old or spiking data
        balanceAfter - balance the thread pool after this many tasks have run

      • newBalancingThreadPoolExecutor

        public static BalancingThreadPoolExecutor newBalancingThreadPoolExecutor(java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor tpe,
                                                         float targetUtilization,
                                                         float smoothingWeight,
                                                         int balanceAfter)
        Return a BalancingThreadPoolExecutor with the given ThreadPoolExecutor, target utilization, smoothing weight, and balance after values.
        Parameters:
        tpe - the underlying executor to use for this instance
        targetUtilization - a float between 0.0 and 1.0 representing the percentage of the total CPU time to be used by this pool
        smoothingWeight - smooth out the averages of the CPU and wait time over time such that tasks aren't too heavily skewed with old or spiking data
        balanceAfter - balance the thread pool after this many tasks have run
